title: Since printer ink cartridges are so expensive and a new printer usually comes fully stocked and is quite cheap, is it better to buy a new printer every time my ink runs out? - Quora

response.answer_text: Okay, Inkjet printers. Yes, they include “starter” cartridges. Usually good for about 400 prints, depending on what you are printing. Buying a new printer every time you run out of ink may seem like a wash, price wise, but as one other answer pointed out, the generation of “e-waste” would be substantial. Printer prices are kept low, and often on sale, because the ink is relatively expensive. I don’t have any figures on cost of manufacture but it is your continuing to purchase ink that the manufacturer counts on. As to purchasing re-filled ink cartridges. Don’t. More often than not you will ruin your print heads and wind up buying a new printer. The ink formulations are not consistent with the manufacturers standards and will void any sort of warranty for parts replacement. Bottom line. Keep your printer for as long as you can and do not buy a new one just for the starter cartridges. Use the manufacturers ink. DO shop pricing. You can often find deals through the different office stores, Amazon Prime, Walmart, Target, etc. (OD will match pricing for you. We also are now offering a subscription service that includes further discounts. Check with your local store.) Thanks for asking!
